content:
It looks like Apple’s Developer Center is getting a visual refresh as the developer center account page has been updated today with some notable changes. The main view after signing in has gone through a reorganization, making accessing various sections much easier. Moving primary links into a left sidebar view, developer’s can now quickly access their CloudKit Dashboard, Documentation, and even the Bug Reporter.

Though none of the links or resources on the visually refreshed page are considered new to developers, Apple has done a nice job of making them more prominent and easier to find. The visual update may be slowly rolling out or not fully completed as just clicking on the Certificates, Identifiers, & Profiles brings you directly back to the previous look.

You can get a glimpse of what the previous Developer Center looked like just last week with Jeff Benjamin’s tutorial on creating a free developer account.
author: Greg Barbosa
title: Apple Developer Center revamped with new account page interface
